original_solution_mapping.L1: For each class, he has to review the questions of 35 students, in total, he will review 10 * 35 = <<10*35=350>>350 questions.
original_solution_mapping.L2: For the 5 classes, he will review a total of 350 * 5 = <<350*5=1750>>1750 questions.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5052.
    Returns: the total number of questions Professor Oscar must review.
    """
    # L1
    questions_per_exam = 10 # 10 questions on each exam
    students_per_class = 35 # 35 students each
    questions_per_class = questions_per_exam * students_per_class

    # L2
    num_classes = 5 # 5 classes
    total_questions_reviewed = questions_per_class * num_classes

    # FA
    answer = total_questions_reviewed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: For each class, he has to review the questions of {students_per_class} students, in total, he will review {questions_per_exam} * {students_per_class} = <<{questions_per_exam}*{students_per_class}={questions_per_class}>>{questions_per_class} questions.

For the {num_classes} classes, he will review a total of {questions_per_class} * {num_classes} = <<{questions_per_class}*{num_classes}={total_questions_reviewed}>>{total_questions_reviewed} questions.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: For each class, he has to review the questions of 35 students, in total, he will review 10 * 35 = <<10*35=350>>350 questions.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: For the 35 classes, he will review a total of 350 * 35 = <<350*35=12250>>12250 questions.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'students_per_class' (35) was used instead of 'num_classes' (5).
